column5: Since I made the best decision of my life. Packed up and moved north.  Been a fairly steep learning curve on when and where to fish but we're starting to figure things out. Still got a good month of ice fishing left beginning of the season was tough with multiple skunks but starting to put some decent patterns together.  Here's some pics from the last year.
That's what it's all about right there....enjoying the great outdoors...in your backyard so to speak. Looks like you definitely made the right decision and thx for sharing.
Looks like you made a great decision. Nothing like leaving the front door on a sled to go fishing.  Thanks for sharing.
Looks great! So how do you make a living up there?
I'm a truck driver. There is a ton of work up here mostly in mining and forestry but everyone is always hiring.
I'm a weenie  about heavy duty bugs. How are the blackflies and mosquitoes June-July?
Where did you move to? It says London for your location...
Nice area, looks like your having fun!

congrats! Timmins is a great area if you like the outdoors. I'll bite my tongue on the other living conditions and social issues there.  6th picture down, that looks like a char, is it just a huge-greenish speckled trout??

A summer splake the shot of the finder was taken that day trolled dipseys as if on Lake Ontario in 35 to 45 feet of water. Really filled the boat that day 3 of us brought home our limit of 5 and let a bunch go as well

Good for you.  That your Edge 800?  You'll have to invest in a long track for the backwoods lakes.  We weren't able to put the boat in the water until May last two yrs, looks like we'll be a week or two ahead of that this yr (fingers crossed at least)
I've been checking out opportunities up there as well. Looks like a great place to be!!  S.
you sir, are a much smarter man than I. what a life

Good for you glad to see you are  enjoying life I love that area have fished many lakes off the 101 Hwy and Moose hunting as well I know the feeling my wife and I also relocated almost 12 yrs ago from the Niagara area to North of Parry Sound hundreds of lakes to explore and Georgian Bay in itself is an awesome fisheries that being said I am still looking forward to our yearly treck up the 144 hwy to the 101 for our annual  Fly in fishing trip.  Cheers Mitch
